metadata.title: CVE-2022-26126 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in FRRouting through 8.1.0 due to theuse of strdup with a non-zero-terminated binary string inisis_nb_notifications.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1').
